1.long: I reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.

1.long: a man, one of the human race.

a mystery, secret, of which initiation is necessary; in the NT: the counsels of God, once hidden but now revealed in the Gospel or some fact thereof; the Christian revelation generally; particular truths or details of the Christian revelation.

2.long: here, the things here, what is here, what is going on here, the state of affairs here.

belonging to human beings (especially as contrasted with God), human (as contrasted with divine).

4.long: I know, consider, am privy to.

fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.

(a) conj: until, (b) prep: as far as, up to, as much as, until.

5.brief: an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent
5.long: an untranslatable word (under the circumstances, in that case, anyhow), the general effect of which is to make a statement contingent, which would otherwise be definite: it is thus regularly used with the subjunctive mood.
(a) I light up, illumine, (b) I bring to light, make evident, reveal.
hidden, secret; as subst: the hidden (secret) things (parts), the inward nature (character).

5.long: I make clear (visible, manifest), make known.
lit: the heart; mind, character, inner self, will, intention, center.

5.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
each (of more than two), every one.

a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.

into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

9.long: a man, one of the human race.

11.long: I strike with the fist, buffet; hence: I mistreat violently.

11.long: I am unsettled, have no fixed abode, lead a vagabond life.
